website_summaries.verdict: Worth a look if you want an option for just a few people, but it comes with the possibility of a few issues.
pros: A basic inflatable hot tub that doesn't take up an excessive amount of space, as it only fits 4 people
cons: Some longevity concerns noted, including small leaks that cause air loss

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: This would be lovely if it worked. They have had to replace the base unit twice and the pump once in less than seven months of use. The second time I had to pay shipping, at cost of nearly $70.00. Their customer service was very nice the first time I needed a replacement (after only a month of use) but border-line rude on the second occasion, when I complained about the shipping charge. Their excuse was "Well, you get what you paid for. This is an inexpensive product."
customer_reviews.author: Joan M Childs

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing in Wisconsin
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, low maintenance, very easy to maintain and best of all...very relaxing on a Wisconsin night!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Am I one of the unlucky ones?
customer_reviews.text: Received it today after weeks and weeks of research and going back and forth in my head. Set up was easy enough. As of now the tub walls are not maintaining the pressure I filled it with. Since adding water to the tub I have refilled the air 3 times and every time I go check on it it's down again. Tomorrow morning will be interesting UPADTE after less than one full day it is clear that this tub will not hold air. I'm exhausted and disappointed thinking about what I have to do next SEE PHOTO. all those wrinkles go away when I fill it with air.... so far 5 times in 18 hours
customer_reviews.author: Rob Caizza

customer_reviews.title: so prime means nothing on this one except for free shipping of a poor quality tub
customer_reviews.text: Here we go. At first the unit worked ok. Its been 2 months and whamo! Heater has failed. Guess what, NOT returnable! so prime means nothing on this one except for free shipping of a poor quality tub. Just go buy a real hot tub. This will be a short lived enjoyment. After which youll be stuck with a 400$ paper weight. Parts are nearly un-obtainable and if you go to Intex website, try the "contact us" section. The email goes NO WHERE!!! I got ripped off, dont you go and do the same. Should have been like the others and bought it from Wal-Mart. They'd take it back!
customer_reviews.author: Bencro

customer_reviews.title: everyone who is commenting that their customer service is great, don't know who you spoke to but mine ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this unit 1 year, properly stowed it properly, dried it out, I live in AZ so freezing is never an issue, E90 code appeared, now have to drop 70 bucks on new motor pump, everyone who is commenting that their customer service is great, don't know who you spoke to but mine was "tough luck, buy a new part". I own my own business, obviously this is a repeat problem with a lot of people, you would think they would FIX the issue or make the pump better, nope just drop 70 bucks every year and shut your mouth. INTEX you have lost my business INDEFINITELY!
customer_reviews.author: mrunella

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. First we had an issue with ...
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. First we had an issue with the tub. Several of the baffles let loose which caused a large bulge in the side of the unit. The customer service folks at Intex have got to be the most rude people I've ever dealt with. Finally received the replacement tub. Re-set everything up and this tub leaked. Returned it for a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Pete L

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: While the hot tub was wonderful for the first 3 months......it is now an absolute headache. After the three months ALL the hose dry rotted and it has been completely useless ever since. The hoses are not a standard size therefore you can not simply replace them from parts at your local pool/spa supply store. The company does not sell the hoses individually; they want you to buy the entire pump or blower OR the entire console all over again! There is nothing wrong with any of the parts or electronics just every single hose.....We will be using our tax refund to by a proper hot tub/spa, like we should have done in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: We received the hot tub and kept getting an E90 error code (low water flow) and discovered that one of the intakes was not working so it was only getting half as much water flowing through. I called customer service at Intex and this is where things went south...huge hold times, they sent the wrong tub replacement and wanted me to pay to send it back!! I am still trying to get them to send the correct replacement tub. Go with the Coleman they have MUCH better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first, but after only about 30 hours of use the heater is shot. I followed all instructions, checked chem levels, changed filters, everything and the heater just won't work anymore. Less than a year old. Called customer support, and there is only the 30 day Amazon warranty. My toaster came with a 1 yr warranty. Seriously, 30 days?? I bought it in September but only put it up this year, so technically it is still new and yet no help. Very disappointed. Checked you-tube for repair suggestions....there were tons of videos hence this is a common problem that the company has failed to address. My suggestion...don't waste your money for what essentially becomes a small pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a few months the tubing got hard, brittle ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the tubing got hard, brittle and broke apart. Intex REFUSES to provide replacement tubing for free or for sale. They claim it's not available. There's no point to buying this if it's going to fall apart after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: WilGeno

customer_reviews.title: this thing is great!!
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great!!! Use it daily, nice sturdy material seems solid, amazing bubble massage. cant beat it for the price. much bigger than expected, im 5'10 and don't have a problem with room to float. only had for a week but so far looks great and works great. time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: greg mowry

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I got this product with a lot of missing parts. I have never had a worst experience with something I have bought from Amazon before. I really believe this item was a return and no one looked in the box to make sure it was a complete set. I struggled trying to put together without a parts list. I Utubed and noticed it was missing a lot of parts. I then had to struggle putting it back in the box to ship back. I had to give it one star just to send this review. It did not deserve a star at all. :(
customer_reviews.author: Doris Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and keep up. More room than what I thought. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intex Spa 77 inch BAD PUMP/ HEATER now not usable
customer_reviews.text: Loved the spa 1st year, easy set up and used it with my son with significant special needs. He can't wait to get in "his little pool!" every day. But after 1 season the base will now not pump or heat the water at all. Major bummer as no way to heat the water to make it a safe swimming temperature. The cost to buy a new pump is $290.00, the whole set up for the original spa set was $329.00... Just so disappointed. When I went on-line to see possible solutions, E 90 error codes and broken pump/heater was THE NUMBER 1 COMPLAINT for this Intex spa. Please help Amazon. Thank you, Sue
customer_reviews.author: Sue D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Spa Pump that doesn’t last!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this spa back in November 2019 and the overall structure of the spa itself is pretty nice. However, after 6 months of use, the pump has now stop working. It will no longer filter but the bubbles still work. Gettinf E90 error. After much troubleshooting have determined that the motor that controls filtration has gone bad. Six months later??!! I would recommend a product that stops working in 6 months. Not worth the $450.00 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Cocky4two

customer_reviews.title: Nice.... well rounded spa- see video
customer_reviews.text: See Full video for complete set-up from out of delivery box to ready to use. Fairly easy to set up but you have to hunt for the instructions inside one of the contained boxes. Very sturdy and a person can easily sit on the side while entering the spa. Tons of bubbles and great size. Could 6 adults fit ..... small adults... yes, Normal size adults .... probably not. I’d guess 4 comfortably sitting not laying out floating.
customer_reviews.author: Angela AA

customer_reviews.title: Intex service was pretty good on getting me a replacement pump EDIT- it died again.
customer_reviews.text: It took only two months for the pump to fail, one month for Intex to send me the replacement pump, and then two days later for the heater to fail! Out of the three months I owned this, it has only worked for two of them. For the price, and what I've had to spend to help cover it from the sun and insulate it from the ground, I should have just bought a real hot tub. Intex service was pretty good on getting me a replacement pump, but I'm very disappointed that its failing within three months of being brand new. EDIT: The replacement failed, got another base unit, then it failed. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Ahatz

customer_reviews.title: Pleasanty surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Updating from 3 starts to 1 start. After 4 months unit does not function. Keypad will not respond and get "E95" error code. Intex customer service will not respond to inquiries on their website (sent 4 so far) and on the phone they say "let it cool and restart". Well it's been off for a long time and the water is cold.... They won't offer other assistance. Was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: TRB

customer_reviews.title: Great for a couple months,, but motor will go out EVERYTIME
customer_reviews.text: so, we had to come to the conclusion that this is a disposable jacuzzi. After a few months, the pump mechanism rod will fail. Happens all the time. Tried different fixes, it all fails.. SO,, it gets a 5 star review for a couple months, then down to a 1 after that. Fix your problem intex...
customer_reviews.author: Mako Side

customer_reviews.title: Not for us, Error Code occurred in first two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this hot tub which assembled very easily. The heating/blower unit can inflate and warm water, simple enough these days. As of 12 days into usage, with no abnormal use, the Error code E90 occurred. This code directly stops the hot tub usage and the water will start to cool down as the unit will not function. We've cleaned the filters after each use, only used the hot tub when we are clean, made sure the PH is correct, etc. (I've used the internet for about 3 hours to get ideas to fix the issue but it returns every restart.) Unfortunately this product is not for us.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewBuyReview

customer_reviews.title: Air leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have air leak problems with this product several times. I have exchanged already twice and happens again. Now we need to add air daily, we have searched extensively for the air leak and we cannot find it. Otherwise it works perfect, but it is difficult to keep adding air everyday to the inflatable shell. Despite the problems with the spa, the amazon customer support was awesome and replaced it twice for us, the third one we got did not leak over a month, so the replacement time frame expired and we got stuck with the defective one.
customer_reviews.author: RMA

customer_reviews.title: worst customer support you can imagine.
customer_reviews.text: Do not order! Won't shut off. Contacted company over a dozen times, mostly to get a different rep who spoke English and absolutely clueless on how to help me. There was no answer to how to fix the problem, no add'l number to call. Very helpless and just want it to go away. Electric bill double because unit would not shut off after reaching desired temperature. Because of language difficulty I could never get across the actual problem I was having, almost like a comedy routine. So frickin frustrating!!!
customer_reviews.author: Loraine Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Defective pumps and manufacturer knows about it
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use this for a month only it's great but the pump for it breaks repeatedly. If you look up online thousands of customers have complained their pumps break multiple times before the warranty even expires and after 1 free replacement during warranty you have to pay to ship it back each time and wait months to have a working hot tub. DON'T BUY. THIS DESERVES A CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT FOR FAULTY PUMP PARTS THAT COME OFF BALANCE AND WEAR OUT REALLY FAST
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's unfortunate because it's a great product other than this one part that only lasts ...
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub came with a 1 year warranty, during that year the control panel displayed E90 and the motor had to be replaced 3 times. It is now 3 months out of warranty and it is once again displaying E90. With all 4 motors the hot tub starts out running quietly but becomes louder and louder until finally you get E90. It's unfortunate because it's a great product other than this one part that only lasts a few months. I'm going to look for a similar product from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Travmeister

customer_reviews.title: great for about a month
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this spa, till the second filter quit working and the cover will no longer hold air. We tried to fix the second filter to no avail and the cover has a tiny leak that we can't find. Reached out to vender on the filter issue. No response. Wish I could recommend as we LOVED it... till we didn't. :(
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase any Intex PureSpa! They will deflate within 9-12 months and customer service doesn’t work with you at all!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased both the 4 and 6 person PureSpa Hot tubs. First, the 4 person hot tub started leaking within 9 months of purchase. Received a free replacement and that one only lasted 10 months. After not getting anywhere with customer service I was dumb enough to purchase a 6 person hot tub thinking it might be constructed better. Well, here I am again with a leaking hot tub and Customer service says “Sorry, there’s nothing we can do.” Save yourself time and money and buy a product that will be covered by the manufacturer. 1st tub = $349.00 2nd tub =$389.00 One free replacement Total = $738.00 for 3 years worth of use
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The product was defective. It did not hold air and did not heat above 72 degrees Fahrenheit. The tub was set up and filled, and the temp did not get over 72 for 24 hours. The tub did not hold air after being filled 3 times in a 24 hour period. I requested a replacement from Amazon so I will update. So far, I am disappointed. I love intex and I have a boat and kayak, but this is ridiculous for such an expensive inflatable tub.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Pump - Heating System Not Built to Last / No Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: The heating pump system died after one season and the customer support is non existent. I've put in several requests by calling and submitting complaints and no one has helped me. I would gladly buy a whole new motor but that isn't an option. I would not recommend buying this product unless you are planning on using it for only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Call

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase of the year! So easy to set up and get started. The longest part was waiting for it to fill up with water. The bubble massage is surprisingly very powerful and 104 degrees is plenty hot. Recommend getting the cup holders and a floating light show to fully enjoy the experience. I've had this for 3ish weeks and have used it several times. Very relaxing! Make sure to get your chemicals situated right away and possibly get a cordless vacuum (I got one) to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: if i could give it more stars I would!
customer_reviews.text: This tub is amazing! I set it up myself in around an hour. I use it at least 2x a week. Its easy to take care of/ fix. We have had ours coming on 2 years and it still works perfectly. We have even moved houses with it! I recommend this to everyone, friends, family, strangers. It's really such a great solution for those who can't/ don't want a traditional tub. it is durable, easy to set up and has been a delight to own.
customer_reviews.author: lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Time & Money on this Product
customer_reviews.text: Had the Hot Tub for a year, Motor Base went. Under warranty, it was replaced....Took more than a Month & a half to Get. Now we run it since March 2018, Motor Base ( dealing with Heat & Water Regulator) stops working. Called Customer Service twice( Customer Service the first time hung up was rude) Warranty Expired( above 90 Days) Can’t Help you?! Spend $260 for a New Base?! The Coleman Motor Base lasted Longer than 2yrs- Word to the wise, You want a Hot Tub? Invest in the real thing. Intex- Improve & Back Up your Product! Or- Have additional warranty for all parts! We couldn’t enjoy it-
customer_reviews.author: Ali23son

customer_reviews.title: should have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Better late than never. It's been a fun ride making the purchase, getting used to testing the chemical levels, accessorizing, and so on. This was a complete kit; all you need after is find a pool and spa supply store for starter chemicals and water sample testing. Had this set up and running in about two hours without a second hand. Ten days since startup and it's running flawlessly. Buy spare filters right away and put a bromide tab inside one of the filter housings if you want to speed up dissolution (the included dispenser is a joke). Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Boomerang86

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts...Intex Customer Service policy very bad
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasts...I had a leak in the tub and the pump stopped working with an E90 error about 9 months after purchase. Intex sent a replacement tub and pump base unit, great. Well, those also failed within 2.5 months. I called Intex for this and was told the original warranty had expired and there was nothing they could do. So, the brand new replacements that I was sent 2.5 months prior aren't covered by any warranty. Customer Service rep was very short and had no desire to discuss this, it is what it is. The tub was great when it worked, but I expected to get much more use out of this before failure. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Best money I’ve ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: We are new to the PureSpa and so far, delighted! I was very hesitant about spending the money for this product. How good can an inflatable hot tub be?!.....AMAZING!! We live in Cincinnati where the weather is unpredictable. It was 55 when we set it up and it was 25 and snowing that night. It took 2 full days for the water temperature to get from 50 to 101. Once it did, it maintains pretty well. Set up was so easy and took less than an hour from start to finish. We’ve always wanted a hot tub but couldn’t afford one or the installation of one. This was a perfect option for us and it honestly does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cincy

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: The temperature does not get quite as warm as what I would like but the main issue is the air leaks out of the inflatable and will not hold air I have to fill it four times a day I've done that for a week I've tried to find the leak to no avail...... after hours and hours of work I've only sat in it three times
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Our Intex 85in PureSpa Portable Bubble hot tub arrived with a slow leak so it collapsed after about 8 hours. This original hot tub was returned via Amazons easy return policy and though getting it back into the same box it came in was a two person wrestling match it was accomplished. Our replacement has preformed well for over a month keeping temperature near 104 even with snow coming down but temperatures do fall faster when bubbles are engaged. We chose intex after purchasing a intex kayak couple years ago and a above ground intex pool last summer and a few pool toys they have all held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: We got Six uses out of it. Horrible construction.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality. We received ours for Christmas but did not set up until first of Feb due to bad wether. Since then we have used 6 times. Had to patch the top 3 times due to holes appearing. It now has a whole in the the tub itself and will not hold water. We bought a pad to place underneath for extra protection and have been very gentle getting in and out and still have ended up with a hole. I get this product is only a little over 300 dollars, although I figured I would get more than 6 uses out of it. Spend the extra money and get a Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy, filling took about 2 hours total (I did 20 minutes increments of hot water to put less strain on my water heater and the hot tub). It was to a balmy 104 degrees by the next morning. Works great, requires little maintenance, has very low evaporation with the included lid when not in use, and works great with the intex add-ons. I was skeptical of how well an inflatable hot tub would bubble, but it's more intense than I expected. Throw on some inflatable headrests and a cup holder and you're all set! Great value for what you get. P.s. I wrote this review from the comfort of my new hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best $250 I’ve ever spent
customer_reviews.text: Got this during a special sale as a Christmas gift to the family. Originally bought it as a kind of joke. Figured we’d use it once and that would be it. Boy was I wrong. Hard to believe you can make an inflatable hot tup that could work so well. I set it up in our outside covered patio just for the winter. Maybe I’ll revise my review next year, but it worked great through the whole winter and looking forward to setting it up again next year.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Gleeson

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed. I have had two of these now
customer_reviews.text: Started leaking not even 6 months in, then summer hit and couldn't use it. I am so disappointed. I have had two of these now, and neither lasted for longer than a year. I have MS and bought this to relieve pain, and am now out almost $1000 between the two purchases. I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wheatcraft

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when my husband said he wanted to order this blow up hot tub, but I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how sturdy it actually is. It was also very easy to assemble and the water heated reasonably quickly. We had it set up and filled by noon and we added the necessary chemicals and the water was warmed enough for us to enjoy it by 9pm that same night. I think it would be a tight fit for 4 adults to sit in it comfortably but I think 3 would fit comfortably, and definitely perfect for 2. We're happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: We've had for over a month. Normally there are two of us in it and it is very comfortable. With three it was still comfortable, just had to position yourselves carefully. With four, it was a bit too crowded for my taste. 104 degrees is reasonable and more than my wife likes, but I'd be happier if it could be made a bit hotter. It takes a while, like they say about 2 degrees per hour, to get up to temperature. Overall, we've really enjoyed it. It is set up semi-permanently, so we'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: B Watt

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE, HOLDS HEAT, RELAXING GETAWAY!!
customer_reviews.text: Smartest buying option for first time hot tubers!! Saved thousands of dollars by trying this sweet popup first. WE LOVE IT!! Holds heat, easy to clean, quiet, filters included (ordering more is easy), keys for locking the top are included (kid safety). This was a very easy assembly. I can't say enough wonderful things about this. My husband is 6'4" and sits comfortably in this, his feet dont touch the other side when in an upright position. The bubbles are fantastic, it's so relaxing! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MaM

customer_reviews.title: We've had our tub for a week now and LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our tub for a week now and LOVE it!! At first we thought we had a small leak but after letting it sit for a day we've not seen anything since. We didn't want to invest in a real tub since we will be moving in the next year and this was a great way to see if we'd use it without sending thousands on it. We've gotten in every night and usually stay for about an hour. The heat does drop around 2/3 degrees per 30 minute run. I'm ok with that because it's still hot enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: ASUcutiepie

customer_reviews.title: Dreaded E90 error
customer_reviews.text: According to Intex, I must log my issue within 15 days of date product received. Since today is day 15 and they are not open, I am logging my issue here. I have cleaned the filters, replaced the filters, drained the tube, made sure nothing is twisted, made sure nothing is blocking the flow of water. Followed every step (twice) in their manual for resolving this issue. This is insanity. I have called "customer service" and they're not open, and tomorrow will be too late, so...now what? I have an unusable birthday gift. Thanks Intex.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to purchase an inflatable hot tub. My fiberglass one finally died and I was really missing my evening soaks but wasn’t interested in spending 8-10 grand on a new one so I took the plunge and made this purchase. This purchase exceeded my expectations and works well for me: The only downside for me was the initial heating. I keep the tub on my deck and live in Maine so it’s still very cold in March and it took a full week to fully heat. I’m happy with the function, size, and ease of use. For the money it was a great deal and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Stout

customer_reviews.title: We love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Oh My Gosh! We love this thing! I was worried about buying it after reading some of the reviews but decided to take the chance and am so far so glad that we did! We bought a roughneck shed to put it in to keep it out of the elements and keep the heat inside (after reading another review) and boy was that a great idea too! It definitely does take a while to heat up and it does lose heat at a noticeable rate when the bubbles are going but that's not a problem for us :) If you are on the fence, I would definitely recommend giving this a chance! I will update if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: J Bollo

customer_reviews.title: Breaks too often
customer_reviews.text: Just don’t buy this. At first, I loved it, I really did. Then the pump failed. I replaced it on my own dime. It’s ceramic and very weak. Then it broke again. So I replaced it again, on my dime. That was a month or two ago. Now it’s got a totally new error. These just aren’t built to last, you need a much longer warranty. Will I buy another? Maybe. Because it’s cheaper than a $3000 hot tub. But it’s going to break on you, just be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. I waited about 3 months to write a review. This is the perfect alternative to not spending a fortune on a hot tub. It is very sturdy and holds temperature well. I’m glad a didn’t let a few bad reviews talk me out of this purchase. You definitely have to clean or replace filter weekly and maintain it though. I just use the garden hose to clean the filters and I get 3 or 4 uses out of 1 filter. Like a lot of people mention the cover loses a small amount of air over a couple weeks but it’s inflatable what do you expect!? For the price I couldn’t be happier with my purchase! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for even a year - however was purchased over a year ago so the company will not offer any warranty. The product also doesn't work below 40 degrees, which is not something that was clearly stated. Also, you shouldn't use bromine in it, which again, is not stated anywhere that I saw. This company doesn't care about helping customers and doesn't stand by their products. We got very limited use out of this before it broke. Definitely would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tub for the money! I use it in an attached garage in Michigan all winter long. Garage stays about 55 degrees. I had a spa in a box for 5 years and went through 3 pumps at $500 each! This is as nice and it only cost $300.00 including the heater/filter. Very durable and the sides are really strong. I have two, one is a 6 person I use in the summer at my cottage on Lake Huron. The grandkids love it and it withstands three of them. The 4 person tub is just right for 1 or 2 persons. Unless you want it cozier:)
customer_reviews.author: JimmyMac

customer_reviews.title: Rigid sides, this is not some floppy dime store pool !
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Placed this spa in our basement. My wife is in it every day, she loves it. The cover prevents excessive, if any evaporation. Rigid sides make it easy to sit on to enter ,exit. The bubbler is very loud, It needs to be variable speed. Since ambient air is used for bubbling, the temp of the outside air determine how fast the water temp drops since the colder air is circulated thru the heated water. Our basement is usually 65+° water temp 100° so after 15 minutes the water will drop to 98°. Not a bad drop at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bobalong

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY this product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tub twice. I am getting the infamous E90 code. Customer service was useless and you can tell by talking to them that they just sit and listen to the same problem day in and day out. Then they tell you that you need new parts and try to sell you some more useless parts. I bought this tub following total joint replacement and expected to be able to use it to rehabilitate. Oh no. It must work in order to use it right? I rarely write reviews but I am fired up over this!!!!!! Worst product ever. If you don't want to be totally frustrated #walkaway!
customer_reviews.author: Doris Holmes

customer_reviews.title: ... had the spa 5 days but so far it's great. Very easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the spa 5 days but so far it's great. Very easy set up. About 1 hour from start to finish. Filling with water was pretty quick too. The initial hearing process took about 16 hours. From 55 to 104. It's perfect size for 2-3 people. I set it up indoors and it's been wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This could be the best online purchase I've ever made. High quality product through and through. I merely purchased this just to see what the hype was all about but I was pleasantly surprised. Very easy setup and up and running in under an hour. The bubble jets were much more powerful than I figured they would be. Temps have held with the cover on quiet nicely. Very satisfied with this purchase so much that I'm taking out a much more expensive hot tub and replacing it with this one. Much sturdier than you would think...Did I mention I really love it?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Home birth pool, excellent product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I bought this for the family to louge in. Also we are having a home birth, and this can double as a birthing pool. I set it up, and didn't add chemicals... And the water got foul over 16 hours and clogged the filters. After treating the water with chlorine, everything is great. Obviously we won't have the baby into chlorine, but into regular tap water. Also, I bought the product at X price, and then a week later it was at Y price. I contacted the company, and they took care of the difference. I own several Intex air mattresses and kids pools, and now a hot tub . Couldn't be happier with the product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: The Dills

customer_reviews.title: Great products when it actually works
customer_reviews.text: The pump is not strong enough at all Had to take the entire pump apart after second use due to code error 90 Made it work again but filters need replacement every two to three uses and be careful when you take the pump apart to not break anything or lose pieces Bubbles are amazing though and when it works properly it is a great way to relax Clean filters by soaking overnight in bleach and water. It works amazing and saves you money Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This spa delivers what it advertises!
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a mild climate and just desire a hot tub to soak in, then this portable spa will be for you. I set it up in less than thirty minutes and filled it with preheated water. I live in Central Florida and have an outdoor shower. I tapped into the hot water line and ran a dedicated line out to where the spa sits, and installed a hose connection to provide endless hot water from my tankless hot water heater. I love soaking in the tub, especially on a brisk evening.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about 3 months now and I really like it, its easy to set up and we just wanted something to easy the aches and pains at the end of the day. It has a little padding on the bottom and a ground cover so its not a hard bottom. easy to maintain and the heater does shut off after 72 hours of no use, so it saves money on electricity. I haven't noticed a big jump in our bill either.
customer_reviews.author: JShaffer

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June, 2016. The pump/motor went out in September and they sent a new unit, then the new unit went out in May. Since we did not ship it back before one year was up, we did not get a new unit sent by Intex. I am very disappointed that this product did not last longer. When it's working, it works great, but it just does not last.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Chambliss

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE JUNK!....Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for ONE season....Packed away carefully in basement and following spring the pump/heater unit stopped working showing an error code....looked up code which showed a broken pump impeller shaft....disassembled pump via youtube fixed the broken shaft, worked for two days and then same code popped up again....Apparently this is quite common with this pump unit...pump is useless and very cheaply made...steer clear of this item and you will be much happier and $400 richer
customer_reviews.author: kbbryant

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was reasonable. Price acceptable. However durability is way below what we expected. This product was in use by adults only and maintained. The hot tub hasn’t been continuously plugged up but 1 weeks ago it began making some irregular noises. Shrugged it off. NOTE: This unit has stayed in one spot and indoors since assembly. However fast forward to yesterday I noticed not only the strange and much louder noise but it also lost a noticeable amount of air. I guess once the holiday is over I will be calling. I expected to get more than 2 months from this hot tub. And yes the filters, though hard to find locally were changed.
customer_reviews.author: MomHackx

customer_reviews.title: spa is really as good as it sounds!
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical this much good could come at such a comfortable price! We are so happy we made this purchase! It is exactly as it states. It was easy to assemble, sturdy, comfy and lovely to enjoy. Our bodies get top notch relaxation in this little spa. It is plenty big enough for my hubby and I! So happy with this purchase! Did I mention SOOOO happy!??
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Intex hot tub. The first one stopped working after an electrical surge disabled the tub’s cord circuit breaker. It lasted 4 years. Not bad for$350. It’s great to relax in, we used it several times a week usually starting in June and through October. Some increase in the electric bill of $30-40/ month. Easy to maintain. I check the chemicals 2 times a week and adjust as needed and the water stays clear and healthy. The temperature is always on target as long as it’s running. Do not place this in direct sun in the summer as ours got a bubble in side.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence A. Walser

customer_reviews.title: Great for aches and pains!
customer_reviews.text: We are aging and we have back, knee and joint pain. This spa has relieved some of our daily issues with chronic pain. We love it! It was super easy to put up, easy to fill and keeps the temperature up. If you live in a cold climate or use during the winter I would recommend putting a piece of large foam under it to keep the temperature up. It is wonderful. It is nice because unlike a large spa we can move it any time. We use it almost every day. Great find!
customer_reviews.author: amazingliz

customer_reviews.title: Totally relaxing, but not an adult 4 person hot tub,built more like for 2 adults.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. Super easy to assemble. I purchased the a salt water unit so it is virtually maintenance free. Unfortunately, 2 weeks ago the circular inflated top deflated. I looked for a hole anywhere, didn't find anything. Inflated it again and the next day it's flat again. I don't know why, there's no way it could have been punctured and I can't find out where the air is coming out from. I'll contact the company to see if they can replace it, but otherwise it is totally relaxing after a hard days work or just a treat for the body and soul!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disposable spa
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed the spa for the fall and spring. But when water starting squirting out of the control panel, we took it off and found the faulty part. After trying to find the replacement on the website and then calling and waiting on hold for hours, I found out that A. the warranty was voided because we reacted to water flying out of the panel by taking it apart and B. we can only replace the entire panel for $256. So, it was alright while it lasted but customer service is a joke and it is obviously considered a disposable product. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot tub
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rate this product it was surpose to be delivered on Wed June 11 and We are still waiting for it,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bubbles are powerful YES!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect spa for our tiny yard. I assembled it myself and found it to be pretty easy. The bubbles are powerful enough to satisfy my aches and pains. Usually jets from a standard jacuzzi are too powerful and leave me itchy. These are perfect. I suggest you watch the YouTube video to install before you start. Directions didn’t tell me to place protective liner before inflation. No worry. I just scooted the tub and shoved that thing under it. That’s the first step. I’ve been in this spa twice each day this summer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Tub quality failure.
customer_reviews.text: Intex check your quality control and manufacturing and packaging. We got this one to replace our worn out old on and it won’t hold air in the main tub. It’s covered with these marks that appear to be from folding and packaging while the product was to hot. I also called their warranty line today and left my call back number and never got called back. If I don’t get this resolved by tomorrow I will return it to amazon!l and put a stop payment on my CC.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Monique

customer_reviews.title: For a $1 a day you can have a hot tub.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just over a year. Used in a non sun covered location, lightly by two adults. Worked fine for the first year then developed a small air leak that we were able to patch. That bought us about another week or so. The patch held but it then developed a tumor and eventually turned in to a 8 in tear. Not repairable. So for about an $1.00 a day you can have a hot tub, if you use it everyday. 2 stars because it worked but did not last as long as I would have hoped for the price. Also some of the water lines cracked and I replaced at about the 6 month point.
customer_reviews.author: WLC101

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible spa, can’t get enough of it! Was easy to set up, easy to maintenance, and creates a lovely relaxing oasis in the backyard!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marquis Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I had this product dropped off at my home yesterday, I pulled it from the package and blew it up to find a big tear in the side of the tub. I then viewed several other rating on the Intex spa products and noted many other ratings of this same issue. I buy products everyday from Amazon and have had decent luck. This is one product I would never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years and still running
customer_reviews.text: 4/18/2020: Update Still running strong. Cleaned filters and added one chlorine tablet weekly. 03/30/2019: Had this unit since Black Friday, so November 2018. All I can say is nothing but good times! I maintain it with clorox chemicals. Water is always clear. Ive had the pump throw that e90 error only after taking the water filter off and cleaning it. I would suggest after removing the water filter, to submerge it back into the tub for a minute to get out all the air in the filter. So far it has solved the e90 issue. Heater is still kicking after 5+ months. I use this in the Phownix area. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Jeana & Eric

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: Ease of installation. It blew my mind when I found out it even inflates itself! I thought I'd have to use a vacuum or air compressor but OH NO, it does it by itself. Fabulous little 4 person pool/hot tub for the price. Cover clips on secure, there is nothing we didn't like!
customer_reviews.author: macdragonflies

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Pump went 3 months in.. Intex sent parts promptly. Worked for 6 months then pump went again. Now no warranty. Paid $280 on Amazon now Amazon doubles the price to $479??? Buyer beware. Unit is not worth that price considering it will only last less than 1 year..
customer_reviews.author: K...

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is actually by third inflatable hot tub. And by far the best. The first two I went a bit less expensive which turned out to be a mistake. Both of the first two suffered from leaks in the tub -- a critical problem for an inflatable hot tub. This one, after three weeks of use, hasn't lost any air. It's built very sturdy. I've set a 104 degree temperature and it gets close. You lose heat quickly when you take off the cover -- primarily because of the six foot diameter size... lots of surface for the heat to escape. Overall, great buy. Great Product
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Bob

customer_reviews.title: worst company ever
customer_reviews.text: The hottub was great untill the pump went in April of 2020. Contacted intex many many many times for replacement parts with no help. They responded by email 3 times but gave me a run around and no help at all. They are hands down the worst company's custo.er service and as a past consumer of many of thier products I now will never recommend, use ,or do business with them again .Save your money and go with another co.panies product as intex does not practice good business models and uses shotty parts and equipment
customer_reviews.author: ken dawson

customer_reviews.title: Happy but strange bumps on tub floor appearing.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve been pretty pleased with this product. However after 2 months I have notice a small section of the tub floor has developed these bumps. They are raised like bubbles. See photo. I put layer down and it is on a cleaned and smith concrete pad so there was nothing underneath a to cause this. I am going to empty and examine underneath. Has anyone else seen this after such a short time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Diemer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this faulty product It worked for only one season We had to replace several parts then the pump Completely broke. No replacement parts available and we have been trying for months !!!!!!! Have had to repair several leaks as well Customer service is horrible. I sat on hold for over 2 hours. The rep was nice enough but basically told me I’m out of luck !!!! I’m so disappointed in a company that’s non stop recording kept repeating how intex is the best and they take such pride in their excellent customer service ....please !!!!! The worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.author: Janet Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical at first when ordering. However, this has been a great surprise. I didn't have the ability to have a hot tub built nor did I want to spend that kind of money as I am only staying a few years. It is really good. Setup was easy, instruction left a little to be desired. Just be aware, it does take time to heat the water after setup, then it stays around temp fairly well, maybe drops 3 degrees. Yes, after a week, I can recommend this, if anything negative happens, I'll update. Drink holder is great. Headrest is okay, doesn't stay in place that well, but works.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kibler

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for.It is 60 degrees in Arizona at dusk and the spa with the cover on is 104,the minute you take the cover off it will drop 1 degree every 10 minutes with the bubbles on.It will drop to 97 and stay there.Its not a 10k spa with a 220v heater so don't expect much.After you plug it in it will take 4 days to heat all the way up.
customer_reviews.author: cantsleep41

customer_reviews.title: Love this spa!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this spa to help with my back. I went back and forth over which inflatable spa to buy. Didn't want to spend a lot of money but also wanted something that would last. I settled on this spa set. It was easy to set up. I live in East Tennessee and it can get cold here. We have had some temps down in the teens and the spa was able to hold the 102 degrees that we had set. Have had the error code 90 twice but after changing the filters it reset. For the price and convenience you can't go wrong with this spa.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money! After one month of use, the pump assembly porcelain rod shattered rendering the spa tub completely useless. Instead of offering replacement parts, customer service tells you to buy a replacement pump assembly THAT IS NOT AVAILABLE per THEIR website. A friend of mine bought one and guess what? Same problem! Unfortunately she never mentioned this problem before I made my purchase. She’s been trying to get a pump assembly replacement for 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrianna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up. Great controls. I have owned multiple expensive hot tubs - this of course is not the same, but for the price it is great. Very large - I would recommend for parents of young children for small pool even if you don't need heat. Unlike expensive hot tub, you can move it any time you need to without any problems. Great cover that really keeps in heat. For price awesome.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGuy

customer_reviews.title: Does well for an inexpensive hotub.
customer_reviews.text: Tub is well built holds temp fairly well. The pump seems to run most of the time but doesn't affect our electric bill tremendously. Tub adds about $25. Per month to our bill. We use it every other evening. We are using it in southern AL. So dont know how it would perform in cold climate.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Sickles

customer_reviews.title: We love this hot tub
customer_reviews.text: We love this hot tub...we use it on the weekends and it is currently in our basement...so easy to set up...it does take 24 hours to fully heat. ...but this works for us....we bought a starter chemical pack and the levels are easy to maintain...puts out a ton of bubbles...super super impressed. .cant wait till summer to put it outside! Highly recommend this product! !
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN FISHER

customer_reviews.title: best investment ever
customer_reviews.text: This thing is totally cool. I am able to sit my 295 lb self on the side of the wall. Self contained , took me 30 minutes to blow it up and set up. about an hour to fill with water. A little over a day to get to 104 degrees. I am so impressed with the durability of this product and the simplicity. Keep the temp near 100 degrees or turn down to 88 for an instant pool. Mine is on a back patio in a screened in porch. I am telling all my friends , Best $400 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Glenn Cord

customer_reviews.title: For $500 bucks - GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome perfect for our deck and a great "try before you buy" (the real thing). It was together in a matter of minutes (according to my husband), filled and fully operable by the next morning (temperature wise). I will say I don't see how this thing will bare the elements of Vermont in the winter, so we will be brining it inside. We ordered a 6 person so the 4 of us would have a fighting chance of fitting - WISE CHOICE. Easy to maintain and chlorinate uses very little. The cover is great for keeping the debris out too. It does tend to foam up a lot if you're wearing suits I'm guessing from the detergents.
customer_reviews.author: Paula L

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good -Update! 9/10
customer_reviews.text: We just got our 85 inch intex spa and enjoy it. We didn't struggle to set it up and instructions were simple to follow! The spa included the matt, cover top, attachments and main unit. Overall it took about 45 mins to set up and filling it with air was about 10 mins until it was firm. We have a 10x12 deck and it fit perfectly on it! Pros: Easy set up Doesn't take up a lot of room Easy to use Cons- Less than two weeks we’ve had Error90 We are purchasing new filters to see if that will solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: brittnany

customer_reviews.title: Don't Use Intex Hot Tub - NO support or help at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product exactly 1 year now. The setup is very simple, the cover is great, and the size is perfect for us. The issues are that every month or so I have a new error message. I have replaced a rod to get rid of error E91. Now I have E95 and E99 and can not get it fixed at all. Heat sensor. I am a single mother and no help to fix this thing. If you are looking for something that doesn't break, DON'T USE INTEX!
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: It's fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy has ASD and I bought this so he could "swim" during COVID. It is so sturdy. The sides are solid. My husband and son put it together in a half hour. It's just pretty awesome! There's a ton of price gouging. Prior to COVID this thing was between 350 and 450. Out of desperation, I paid 650$ but it's well worth it so far!
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE THIS! It IS easy to set up ( single 65 yo woman) even by myself! I filled it from my washing machine hookup so I could use the hot water. It was in the 40’s when I filled it so it took a while (couple days) to get up to 101*. But it is Fantastic! I don’t like the jets on in most tubs , so the bubbles are fine..I actually don’t have them on much, because the temp goes down so fast then. Easy to keep clean and minimal chlorine to keep sparkling clear. Cover is easy to put on and take off, too! My sore knees feel so much better now!
customer_reviews.author: ann gates

customer_reviews.title: Love it, However..... I have to constantly add air
customer_reviews.text: I waited a month to post my review so I could give accurate information on my spa. Let me say I LOVE THE SPA! BUT, it doesn't hold air well at all. I have to add air DAILY which is why I am giving it a 3 star rating. To me that is a not a deal breaker just an inconvenience. The heater and pump work outstanding! With the cover on it holds temp well even in the near freezing temps of my enclosed uninsulated back deck. I keep it at 104 so when I get in, I dont mind it loosing a couple degrees. Great spa for the price if you dont mind adding air daily.
customer_reviews.author: D Liam Tucker

customer_reviews.title: They absolutely loved it and bragged to friends neighbors co-workers about how ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my parents. Had it now for almost a year to date. Mind you no kid use at all. Two 60 yr olds. Dad's a retired Marine and is very anal about taking care of and maintaining his belongs. House, grass, cars, yard, pool, ect... They absolutely loved it and bragged to friends neighbors co-workers about how much bang it was for the buck. The hot tub it's self is ripping at the seams on the inside and will no longer hold air. The rubber hoes used in the filter broke at the plastic fittings..
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the price, especially since we could never afford a "real" hot tub. We have been enjoying this hot tub daily in our basement until the weather gets nicer, then we'll take it outside. This was the only inflatable hot tub we could find that allows you to run the heater and the bubbles at the same time. The temperature drops pretty quickly with the bubbles on, though. Since it comes all folded up, there are several creases that look like they could turn into holes easily, and that did happen to ours, but it comes with 2 patches. Overall, we are really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It starts to cool off the longer the lid is off, but I just get in alone daily for my fibromyalgia. The lid keeps the heating costs down and it requires very little work. I only use chlorine granules and non-chlorine shock by Leisure Time. All the other chemicals aren't important. It takes Intex S1 filters and I only change 1 filter a week. I leave the best one till the next week. I love it! Also don't worry about it being air inflatable cuz I sit on the side and it is firm.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: E90 ERROR.  UNIT HAS MUNUFACTER FLAW on impeller shaft
customer_reviews.text: This unit gets a E90 ERROR. The 2 7/8 white ceramic shaft has a manufacturer flaw it wobbles inside the impeller shift causing it to get scored and not work. INTEX will try to sell you a whole new pump. Instead of fixing thier flaw. They don't stand behind thier product. Very dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: kim geercken

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was very easy and took me less than an hour to put together. Took less than 24 hrs to heat it up and it has worked amazing! Feels so nice at night to sit in it! We only had one issue and got an E90 code, but the filter just needed to be changed and that fixed it. Therefore make sure you change filter frequently. Love this purchase! Paid a bit more than I would have liked, but so far it's been put to use a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sun

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year, air pumped failed (they said cause I didn't tie into a GFI outlet), customer service tells me they don't sell just the pump and I have to buy the entire $300 unit instead. Customer service was a hit or miss during the times I called to troubleshoot this issue. I mean, it's $400. What can you say? I understand things break, just sell us the $40 part instead. Lame Edit: after more digging, I finally figured out the part (myself, cause customer support couldn't help figure it out), but part can't legally be shipped in the USA separately. Hmmmm, bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Cooter McWilliams

product_meta.title: Intex 77in PureSpa Portable Bubble Massage Spa Set
product_meta.description: Size:77 in / 4-Person| Style:Massage Spa SetPamper yourself in relaxing heated water surrounded by soothing bubble jets. The Pure Spa provides relaxation at the touch of a button for up to four people. The easy-to-use control panel activates the 120 high-powered bubble jets surrounding the interior of the spa for a refreshing massage. The Fiber-Tech Construction and the puncture-resistant 3-ply laminated material provide the ultimate comfort, support and durability. Heater - 1300 W.
feature_bullets: The built in hard water treatment system makes water gentler on skin for a soothing experience
An insulated cover and lock is included to minimize heat loss and provides an added safety feature
Pure Spa provides simple maintenance with 2 easy to replace filter cartridges for clean refreshing spa water
Age Grading: 6+. Includes: Heating system, 3-way test strip, 2 filter cartridges, floating pool chlorine dispenser, thermal ground cloth, inflation hose, carry bag
Seating capacity: 4 people; Water capacity: 210 gallons; Water temperature range (68 Degrees to 104 Degrees)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars3,012 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
